body_html:
No, I mean feed the initial time to the initializer and have the state carry forward a time tensor, adding Delta at every call.
…
On Oct 2, 2017 2:45 AM, "ebrevdo" ***@***.***> wrote: I don't think feeding the time to the initializer would work since the time changes every time step. we can concatenate the time with the feature tensor and pass a single input tensor. in practice we pass the time as a feature. On Fri, Sep 29, 2017 at 5:12 PM, Eugene Brevdo ***@***.***> wrote: > Right. CC'ing author of PhasedLSTMCell to discuss feasibility of moving > the time component into the state; and modifying the initializer to accept > optional initial time & time delta arguments. > > On Thu, Sep 28, 2017 at 10:21 PM, bingo619 ***@***.***> > wrote: > >> Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to the >> initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work. >> >> I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with >> bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own. >> >> And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs, >> like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504 >> >> — >> You are receiving this because you were mentioned. >> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub >> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/ 11144#issuecomment-333033585>, >> or mute the thread >> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe- auth/ABtim4uqM53gqiWiXtJM_n3wo-tKhtDKks5snH5wgaJpZM4OJm39> >> . >> > > — You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#11144 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABtim4FC-mhFjN5p-NC86w7Bvaxclq_Wks5soLDVgaJpZM4OJm39> .
body_text:
No, I mean feed the initial time to the initializer and have the state
carry forward a time tensor, adding Delta at every call.
…
On Oct 2, 2017 2:45 AM, "ebrevdo" ***@***.***> wrote:
 I don't think feeding the time to the initializer would work since the time
 changes every time step.
 we can concatenate the time with the feature tensor and pass a single input
 tensor.
 in practice we pass the time as a feature.

 On Fri, Sep 29, 2017 at 5:12 PM, Eugene Brevdo ***@***.***> wrote:

 > Right. CC'ing author of PhasedLSTMCell to discuss feasibility of moving
 > the time component into the state; and modifying the initializer to
 accept
 > optional initial time & time delta arguments.
 >
 > On Thu, Sep 28, 2017 at 10:21 PM, bingo619 ***@***.***>
 > wrote:
 >
 >> Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to
 the
 >> initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work.
 >>
 >> I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with
 >> bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own.
 >>
 >> And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs,
 >> like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504
 >>
 >> —
 >> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
 >> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 >> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/
 11144#issuecomment-333033585>,
 >> or mute the thread
 >> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-
 auth/ABtim4uqM53gqiWiXtJM_n3wo-tKhtDKks5snH5wgaJpZM4OJm39>
 >> .
 >>
 >
 >

 —
 You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.

 <#11144 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread

body:
No, I mean feed the initial time to the initializer and have the state
carry forward a time tensor, adding Delta at every call.

On Oct 2, 2017 2:45 AM, "ebrevdo" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> I don't think feeding the time to the initializer would work since the time
> changes every time step.
> we can concatenate the time with the feature tensor and pass a single input
> tensor.
> in practice we pass the time as a feature.
>
> On Fri, Sep 29, 2017 at 5:12 PM, Eugene Brevdo <ebrevdo@google.com> wrote:
>
> > Right. CC'ing author of PhasedLSTMCell to discuss feasibility of moving
> > the time component into the state; and modifying the initializer to
> accept
> > optional initial time & time delta arguments.
> >
> > On Thu, Sep 28, 2017 at 10:21 PM, bingo619 <notifications@github.com>
> > wrote:
> >
> >> Sorry, do you mean instead of feeding the time in a tuple, feed it to
> the
> >> initializer? I think if we can do that, that should work.
> >>
> >> I find feeding tuple input is a disaster anyway, it does't work with
> >> bidirectional_dynamic_rnn either, I had to write my own.
> >>
> >> And it is the same problem when implementing other time variance RNNs,
> >> like this one https://www.ijcai.org/proceedings/2017/504
> >>
> >> —
> >> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> >> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> >> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/
> 11144#issuecomment-333033585>,
> >> or mute the thread
> >> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-
> auth/ABtim4uqM53gqiWiXtJM_n3wo-tKhtDKks5snH5wgaJpZM4OJm39>
> >> .

>
